subtitle: chapter 16 yogi spiritual breathing
the Yogi's not only bring about desired
mental qualities and properties by
willpower coupled with rhythmic
breathing but they also develop
spiritual faculties or rather aid in
their unfoldment in the same way the
Oriental philosophies teach that man has
many faculties which are at present in a
dormant state but which will become
unfolded as the race progresses they
also teach that man by the proper effort
of the will
aided by favorable conditions may aid in
the unfoldment of these spiritual
faculties and develop them much sooner
than in the ordinary process of
evolution in other words one may even
now develop spiritual powers of
consciousness which will not become the
common property of the race until after
long ages of gradual development under
the law of evolution and all the
exercise directed towards this end
rhythmic breathing plays an important
part there is of course no mystic
property in the breath itself which
produces such wonderful results but the
rhythm produced by the yogi breath is
such as to bring the whole system
including the brain under perfect
control and in perfect harmony and by
this means the most perfect conditions
obtained for the unfoldment of these
latent faculties in this work we cannot
go deeply into the philosophy of the
East regarding spiritual development
because this subject would require
volumes to cover it and then again the
subject is too obtrusive
interest the average reader there are
also other reasons well known to a
cultists why this knowledge should not
be spread broadcast at this time
rest assured dear student that when the
time comes for you to take the next step
the way will be open before you when the
chila is ready the Guru appears in this
chapter we will give you directions for
the development of two phases of
spiritual consciousness the
consciousness of the identity of the
soul and the consciousness of the
connection of the soul with the
universal life both of the exercise
given below are simple and consists of
mental images firmly held accompanied
with rhythmic breathing the student must
not expect to
at the start but must make haste slowly
and be content to develop as does the
flower from seed to blossom soul
consciousness the real soul is not the
body or even the mind of man these
things are but a part of his personality
of the lesser self the real self is the
ego whose manifestation is individuality
the real self is independent of the body
which it inhibits and is even
independent of the mechanism of the mind
which it uses as an instrument the real
self is a drop from the divine ocean and
is eternal and indestructible it cannot
die or be annihilated and no matter what
becomes of the body the real self still
exists it is the soul do not think of
your soul as a thing apart from you for
you are the soul and the body is the
unreal and transitory part of you which
is changing the material everyday and
which you will someday discard you may
develop the faculties that you will be
conscious of the reality of the soul and
its independence of the body the yogi
plan for such development is by
meditation upon the real self or soul
accompanied by rhythmic breathing the
following exercise is a simplest form
exercise place your body in a relaxed
reclining position breathe rhythmically
and meditate upon the real self thinking
of yourself as an entity independent of
the body although inhabiting it and
being able to leave it at will think of
yourself not as the body but as a spirit
and of your body as but a shell
useful and comfortable but not a part of
the real you think of yourself as an
independent being using the body only as
a convenience while meditating ignore
the body entirely and you will find that
you will often become almost instantly
unconscious of it and will seem to be
out of the body to which you returned
when you are through with the exercise
this is the gist of the yogi meditative
breathing methods and if persisted in
will give one a wonderful sense of the
reality of the soul and will make him
seem almost
to the body the sense of immortality
will often come with his increased
consciousness and the person will begin
to show signs of spiritual development
which will be noticeable to himself and
others but he must not allow himself to
live too much in the upper regions order
to despise his body for he is here on
this plane for a purpose and he must not
neglect his opportunity to gain the
experience necessary to round him out
nor must he failed to respect his body
which is the temple of the soul the
universal consciousness the spirit and
man which is the highest manifestation
of the soul is a drop in the ocean of
spirit
apparently separate and distinct but yet
really in touch with the ocean itself
and with every other drop in it as man
unfolds and spiritual consciousness he
becomes more and more aware of his
relation to the universal spirit or
universal mind is some term it he feels
at times as he we were almost in a one
atonement with it and then again he
loses the sense of contact in
relationship the Yogi's seek to attain
this state of universal consciousness by
meditation and rhythmic breathing and
many have thus attained the highest
degree of spiritual attainment possible
demand in this stage of this existence
the student of this work will not need
the higher instruction regarding a DEP
ship at this time as he is much to do
and accomplished before he reaches that
stage but it may well be well to
initiate him into the elementary stages
of the yogi exercise for developing
universal consciousness and if he is in
earnest he will discover means and
methods whereby he may regress the way
is always open to him who is ready to
tread the path the following exercise
will be found to do much toward
developing the universal consciousness
in those who faithfully practice it
exercise place your body and a reclining
relaxed position breathe rhythmically
and meditate upon your relationship with
the universal mind of which you are but
an atom
think of yourself as being in touch with
all and at one month with all see all as
one and your soul is a part of that one
feel that you are receiving the
vibrations from the great universal mind
and are partaking of its power and
strength and wisdom the two following
lines of meditation may be used with
each inhalation think of yourself as
drawing into yourself the strength and
power of the universal mind when
exhaling think of yourself as passing
out to others the same power at the same
time being filled with love for every
living thing and desiring that it be a
partaker of the same blessing which you
are now receiving let the universal
power circulate through you to place
your mind in a reverential state and
meditate upon the grandeur of the
universal mind and open yourself to the
inflow of the divine wisdom which will
fill you with illuminating wisdom and
then let the same flow out from you to
your brothers and sisters whom you love
and would help this exercise leaves with
those who have practiced it in a few
found new sense of strength power and
wisdom and a feeling of spiritual
exultation and bliss it must be
practiced only in a serious reverential
mood and must not be approached trifling
or lightly general directions the
exercises given in this chapter require
the proper mental attitude and
conditions and the trifler in person of
a non-serious nature or one without a
sense of spirituality and reverence had
better passed them by as no result will
be obtained by such persons and besides
it is a wilful trifling with things of a
higher order which course never benefits
those who pursue it these exercises are
for the few who can understand them and
the others will feel no attraction to
try them during meditation let the mind
dwell upon the ideas given in the
exercise until it becomes clear to the
mind and gradually manifests in real
consciousness within you the mind will
gradually become passive and at rest and
the mental image will manifest
do not indulge and he's exercised too
often and do not allow the blissful
state produced to render you
dissatisfied with the affairs of
everyday life as the latter are useful
and necessary for you and you must never
shirk a lesson however disagreeable to
you it may be let the joy arising from
the unfolding consciousness buoy you up
and nerve you for the trials of life and
not make you dissatisfied and disgusted
all is good and everything has its place
many of the students who practice these
exercise will in time wish to know more
rest assured that when the time comes we
will see that you do not seek in vain go
on and courage and confidence keeping
your face toward the east from whence
comes the Rising Sun peace be unto you
and unto all men ohm
what is yogi philosophy the yogi
philosophy comprises the teachings which
have come down the centuries of thought
investigations and experiments and
demonstration on the part of the
advanced minds of the yogi masters of
India called diya Persia Egypt and
ancient Greece down to the present time
from master to student guru to chila it
is the oldest philosophy in the world
although to the Western world it comes
as a new message a message from the East
the Masters there have been and all ages
certainly highly developed advanced and
exalted Souls in the flesh known as the
yogi masters and adepts although many of
the tales told concerning them are myths
or pure fictions originating the minds
of some modern sensational writer the
master Yogi's have passed from lower to
higher planes of consciousness thus
gaining wisdom power and qualities that
seem almost miraculous to the man of the
ordinary consciousness a Hindu writer
speaking in mrs. to him who hath
traveled far along the path sorrow
ceases to trouble fetters ceased to bind
obstacles ceased to hinder such a one is
free for him there is no more trouble or
sorrow for him there are no more on
just rebirth his old karma is exhausted
and he creates no new karma his heart is
freed from the desired for future life
no new longings arise within his soul he
is like a lamp with burners from the oil
of the spirit and not from the oil of
the outer world the master Yogi's are
able to pass through material obstacles
walls ramparts he is able to throw his
phantasmal appearance in many places at
once he acquires the power of hearing
the sounds of the unseen world as
distinctively as those of the phenomenal
world more distinctly in point of fact
also by his power he's able to read the
most secret thoughts of others and to
tell their characters such are the yogi
masters the real and the imitation the
Western student is apt to be somewhat
confused and his ideas regarding the
Yogi's and such philosophy and practice
traveled up some have written great
tales about the hordes of fakirs
mendicants and mountebanks who infest
the great roads of india and the streets
of its City and impudently claim the
title yogi the Western student is
scarcely to be blamed for thinking of
the typical yogi as an emaciated
fanatical dirty ignorant Hindu who
either sits in a fixed posture until his
body becomes ossified or else hold his
arm up in the air until it becomes stiff
and withered and forever remains in that
position or perhaps clenches his fist
and holds it tight until its fingernails
grow through the palm of his hand that
these people exist is true but their
claim to the title yogi seems as absurd
to the true yogi as does the claim to
the title doctor on the part of the man
who pairs one scorns scene to an eminent
surgeon or as does the title of
professor as assumed by the street
corner vendor of warm medicines seemed
to the president of Yale or Harvard the
science of yoga there have been for ages
passed in India and other oriental
countries yogi masters who devoted their
time and attention to the development of
man physically mentally and spiritually
the centuries and experience of
generation of earnest seekers
been handed down for century from
teacher to pupil and gradually a
definite yoga science was built up to
these investigations and teachings was
finally applied the term yogi from the
Sanskrit word yoga
meaning to join the three fold path yoga
is divided into several branches ranging
from that which teaches the control of
body to that which teaches the highest
spiritual development men are of varying
temperaments and the course that which
will best suit one will not be adapted
to the requirements of another one will
seek progress in development in one
direction and another in a different way
and a third by still a different course
the yogi philosophy teaches that the way
that seems to appeal the most to a man's
general temperament and disposition is
the one best adapted to his use at the
present time they divide the path of
attainment into three paths leading up
to the great main road they call these
three paths Raja Yoga karma-yoga
jnana-yoga each of these forms of yoga
being a path leading to the great road
and each being traveled by those who may
prefer it but all lead to the same place
we will now give a brief description of
each of the three paths which together
are known to the Yogi's as a three-fold
path the various branches each branch of
yoga is but a path leading toward the
one uninformative element and growth he
who wishes first to develop control and
strengthen his physical body so as to
render it a fit instrument of the higher
self follows the path of hatha yoga he
who would develop his willpower and
mental faculties unfolding the inner
senses and latent powers follows the
path of Raja Yoga he who wishes
developed by knowing by studying the
fundamental principles and the wonderful
truth underlying life follows the path
of jana yoga and he who wishes to grow
into a union with the one life by the
influence of love he follows the path of
bhakti yoga but it must not be supposed
that the student must Olay himself to
only a single one of these paths the
our in fact very few do the majority
prefer to gain a rounded knowledge and
acquaint themselves with the principles
of the several branches learning
something of each giving preference of
course to those branches that appeal to
them more strongly this attraction being
the indication of need a requirement
therefore being the hand pointing out of
the path it is well for everyone to know
something of hatha yoga in order that
the body may be purified strengthened
and kept in health in order to become a
more fitting instrument of the higher
self it is well that each one should
know something of Raja yoga that he may
understand the training and control of
the mind and the use of the will it is
well that everyone should learn the
wisdom of non Yoga and that he realizes
the wonderful truth underlying life the
science of being the scientific and
intellectual knowing of the great
question regarding life and what lies
back of life the riddle of the universe
and it is well that everyone should know
something of bhakti-yoga that he may
understood the great teachings regarding
the love underlying all life the men
best calculated to make general advances
along occult lines is one who avoids
running to extremes in any one of the
branches of the subject but who while in
the main following his own inclination
towards certain forms of yoga still
keeps up a general acquaintance with the
several phases of the great philosophy
in the end man must develop on all his
many sides and why not keep in touch
with all sides why we journey along by
following this course we avoid
one-sidedness fanaticism narrowness
shortsightedness and bigotry those for
whom the teaching are intended our books
are intended only for those who feel an
earnest attraction towards the higher
teaching they are for earnest students
inspired by the highest motive those for
whom these teachings are intended will
feel attracted to them if you feel
attracted towards these work we will be
glad to have you study them if not we
will feel just as kindly toward you and
we'll send you your best wishes for the
highest need of the
when you will be ready for the advanced

the yogi philosophy will prove a

to many it will be the first revelation

many will be the first cup of water from

we can only say that they will be in

the students however will find that when

step let none be discouraged the fact
that this teaching attracts you will in
time unfold its meaning study it over

still remains between you and that
beyond peace beyond to you advice to
